Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw two different habitats, one on land (such as a forest) and one in water (like a pond).
The student can illustrate at least three different types of living things, including both plants and animals, in each habitat.
The student can show specific examples of some plants and animals for each habitat, such as trees for a forest and fish for a pond.
The student can compare the diversity of living things by showing different plants and animals in each habitat, although there may be slight inconsistencies in the representation of diversity.
CANNOT: The student may struggle to consistently label all elements clearly, making it difficult to identify some specific plants or animals (e.g., some plants or animals might not be labeled at all).
The student may have minor gaps in identifying patterns by observing similarities and differences, such as not fully explaining why there are certain similarities or differences between habitats.
